page.title: 20Strensall - Social Concerns
page.content: In common with most local villages, Strensall has a number of agencies concerned with{raising money.} Some help national charities such as the NSPCC and the Lifeboat Fund. The {village hall}in Strensall is very old and inadequate and a great many people have been trying to raise money for a new one for several years. There are talks about trying to build a new hall on the school site to form a{community {school.} All of the concern is to keep Strensall as a community and to provide focal points for people to meet. The many new residents in Strensall tend to look to York for their shopping and entertainment. The {preservation of the local community is very important in many people's opinion and occupies the thoughts and efforts of villagers in other newly built-up areas too.
